Title: Coronavirus: Amazon, Flipkart, Big Basket, Grofers Struggle to Deliver Essentials in India Because of Loc...
Summary:
Platforms like Amazon, Grofers, and Big Basket have all been showing products as out of stock or undeliverable.
This also means that we have to temporarily stop taking orders and disable shipments for lower-priority products,” Amazon said in a statement.
Sources at Amazon, Flipkart, and various other online platforms told Gadgets 360 that the state police forces were restricting their delivery associates from delivering orders at various locations.
The frustration of consumers is obvious since they aren't able to purchase essential products through offline retailers due to closure of local shops in many areas.
— bigbasket (@bigbasket_com) March 24, 2020Big Basket Co-Founders Hari Menon and Vipul Parekh didn't respond to the emails sent by Gadgets 360 at the time of filing this story.

Title: Flipkart temporarily suspends all services as India goes into complete lockdown
Summary:
E-commerce giant Flipkart has temporarily suspended all its services in India after Prime Minister Narendra Modi's call for complete lockdown to curb the spread of coronavirus.
The Walmart-owned company's sudden announcement has come despite the fact that central government has included e-commerce services as one of the essential services in its essential list notification, put out Tuesday evening.
Flipkart has marked all products as 'Out Of Stock' on the search option of its app and website.
The statement reads, "these are difficult times, times like no other.
Many reports of harassing of delivery partners of the e-commerce companies including Grofers and Bigbasket, by policemen in different parts of India, have surfaced on Twitter.

Title: Flipkart suspends services, Amazon to serve only high priority products
Summary:
lockdownFlipkartAmazoncoronavirusAll you need to know: What will be allowed, not allowed during the nationwide lockdown Mumbai, Pune and rest of Maharashtra, nothing changes for us in this lockdown.
Grocery stores will be open so will medical shops and all other essential services, including banks and ATMs.
Amazon to serve only high priority products.
We urge you to Stay Home to Stay Safe!
"Though Amazon will be serving priority products, it has made other products unavailable.Meanwhile, assuring people of the state, Thackeray said that whatever measures the state government has already announced will continue.

Title: Reliance to pay twice to those employees who earn below ₹30,000
Summary:
Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) announced a slew of measures to fight against deadly coronavirus infection spread across the country.
Those who earn below ₹30,000 per month, will get their salaries twice a month in the wake of coronavirus outbreak.
"RIL has deployed the combined strengths of Reliance Foundation, Reliance Retail, Jio, Reliance Life Sciences, Reliance Industries, and all the 6,00,000 members of the Reliance Family on this action plan against COVID-19," the company said.
Reliance Industries also extended the work-from-home platform to most of its employees except those who handle critical roles in maintaining Reliance Jio network.
Reliance Retail across the country will remain functional during the lockdown.

Title: Facebook in talks to acquire 10 per cent stake in Jio: Reports
Summary:
New Delhi: Facebook is said to be in negotiations to acquire a stake in Mukesh Ambani ’s Reliance Jio Infocomm, the Financial Times reported, citing two people with knowledge of the matter.
A deal was to have been announced by March end, the FT said.The FT report said Google had also been talking to Jio separately, citing one of the people above.
Microsoft had said last year that it would provide cloud-computing services to businesses along with Jio.
Reliance Industries aims to sell a 20% stake in its refining business to Saudi Aramco as part of this exercise.
Ambani had spoken of plans to turn Jio into a separate company last year and said there was interest from potential investors at the time.

Title: FB keen on buying 10% stake in Jio; Covid-19 may delay the deal: Report
Summary:
US tech giant is looking to buy a multibillion-dollar stake in Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Jio, reports Financial Times.
According to the report, is keen on picking up a 10 per cent stake in Indian telecommunication behemoth, however, the outspread of coronavirus could alter the schedule of signing the deal.
Facebook, which owns and Instagram, will get a significant footing in the Indian telecom market if this deal goes through.
But the Indian telecom market has not been easy for the foreign players of late due to the adjusted gross revenue issue, which nearly forced the Vodafone group out of the country.
According to the report in FT, Google was also involved in talks with Jio for the purchase of stake.

Title: Facebook is said to be near deal to buy a multibillion-dollar stake in Reliance Jio - MSPoweruser
Summary:
Reliance Jio is the largest mobile network operator in India and the third largest mobile network operator in the world with over 370.07 million subscribers.
In order to reduce its debt pile, Reliance was planning to sell Jio’s stake.
Today, FT reported that Facebook is planning to buy a multibillion-dollar stake in Reliance Jio.
According to the report, Facebook was planning to acquire 10% stake in Jio.
In partnership with Microsoft, Reliance will offer free cloud and connectivity setup to startups for free.

Title: What changed for the market while you were sleeping? Top 10 things to know
Summary:
The Indian market saw some recovery on March 24, with Nifty ending above 7,800-mark, taking cues from firm global markets.
Experts believe the market is likely to remain hugely volatile with in-between recoveries occasionally.
The important pivot level, which will act as crucial support for the index, is placed at 16,201.87, followed by 15,296.43.
MSCI’s broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan rose 1.3% with Australian shares rising 4.5% and South Korean shares gaining 4%.
The investment comes at a time when broader market witnessed significant downtrend amid fears of recession due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Title: Coronavirus in India: Volatility remains high as markets shed early gains
Summary:
A relief package, according to analysts, may help calm down investors who have been panic selling in bulk to avoid the market turmoil.
This led to a rally in Asian stock markets and lifted the mood in domestic markets in India.
A relief package, according to analysts, may help calm down investors who have been panic selling in bulk to avoid the market turmoil.
Despite the relief package, domestic stock markets are expected to remain edgy until the virus is fully contained.

Title: Sensex, Nifty Likely To Open Lower As 21-Day Lockdown Begins
Summary:
Domestic stock markets are likely to start Wednesday's session on a lower note, hours after the government imposed a 21-day countrywide lockdown to control the spread of the deadly coronavirus pandemic.
The Singapore Exchange (SGX) Nifty futures - an early indicator of the National Stock Exchange (NSE) Nifty index - declined as much as 165.9 points to 7,684.00 ahead of the opening of Indian markets.
At 8:02 am, the SGX Nifty was down 144.90 points - or 1.85 per cent - at 7,705.00.
Meanwhile, the Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a slew of relief measures on Tuesday for taxpayers and businesses to aid the fight against the fast-spreading coronavirus pandemic.
Coronavirus has already claimed 10 lives and infected more than 500 people throughout the country.

Title: Grofers, Milkbasket hit by lockdowns in different Indian cities amid coronavirus outbreak
Summary:
A number of ration shops will remain open because they fall under the essential services category during a lockdown.
A number of tweets from online grocery delivery platforms like Grofers, BigBasket, MilkBasket have indicated that authorities have been cracking down on their delivery partners and orders are being cancelled.
One tweet by Grofers exec mentions that their warehouse was closed by local law enforcement agencies in Faridabad.
Our @grofers warehouse in Faridabad was closed by local law enforcement today.While we understand they are doing their duty, essential items will be denied to 20,000+ households in Faridabad and Delhi every day.
(1/4) We @HelloMilkbasket Milkbasket are determined to support families with their daily milk, fruits, vegetables and food requirements.

Title: Sensex, Nifty hold gains as investors pin hope to govt's fiscal package
Summary:
Sensex, Nifty end in the greenIndian equity markets managed to hold decent gains, after rising as much as 5% intraday.
Key indices were volatile in opening trade, but traded higher later in the day buoyed by the rise in IT and fast moving consumer goods (FMCG) stocks.
The markets rose the most when finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Twitter that the government plans to soon announce a fiscal stimulus package.
The Sensex rose 692.79 points, or 2.67%, to end today's session at 26,674.03, while the Nifty 50 index settled 190.80 points, or 2.51%, higher at 7,801.05.
Shares of Infosys led gains on Nifty, followed by Adani Ports, Britannia, Bajaj Finance and Maruti Suzuki, while Mahindra & Mahindra, Grasim Industries, IndusInd Bank, Power Grid Corporation and Bharti Infratel were the biggest laggards in today's session.

Title: Stock Markets LATEST Updates: Markets rebound, end in green; Infosys, Adani Ports, HUL among major gainers
Summary:
Stock Markets LIVE Updates: Markets rebound, end in green; Infosys, Adani Ports, HUL among major gainersUnion Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that the government is preparing an economic package to tide over the crisis created by coronavirus pandemic.
"We are readying an economic package to help us through the corona lockdown and will be announced soon," Sitharaman said in a tweet.
Economic package may be made for daily wagers, corporates and empolyees, reported CNBC TV18 quoting government sources.
Other gainers included HUL, Tech Mahindra, Sun Pharma, Asian Paints, Reliance Industries, TCS, ONGC, HCL Tech and NTPC.

Title: Sensex recovers 693 points amid govt measures to aid coronavirus-hit economy
Summary:
A day after the historic rout, equity benchmark Sensex bounced back to close 693 points higher on Tuesday as investors noted governments across the world taking prompt economic measures to offset the financial damage from the COVID-19 pandemic.
Indian equities followed an improved investor sentiment in Asia after the Federal Reserve announced limitless bond-buying programme to support the U.S. economy.
Meanwhile, Indian Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said an economic package to help through the coronavirus lockdown was in works even as fresh cases of virus spread reported from various parts of the country.
After gyrating 1,823.97 points, the BSE barometer gave up some gains to end 692.79 points or 2.67% higher at 26,674.03.
Traders said extreme lockdown measures taken by the government of India and authorities across the world still weigh on global investor sentiment.

Title: Asian shares track Wall Street surge as US stimulus hopes grow
Summary:
Asian shares extended their rally on Wednesday in the wake of Wall Street's big gains as US Congress appeared closer to passing a $2 trillion stimulus package to curb the coronavirus pandemic's economic toll.
MSCI's broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan rose 1.3% with Australian shares rising 4.5% and South Korean shares gaining 4.0%.
"Japanese shares have been bolstered by aggressive buying from the Bank of Japan and pension money this week.
On Wall Street, the Dow Jones Industrial Average soared 11.37%, its biggest one-day percentage gain since 1933.
Senior Democrats and Republicans in the divided U.S. Congress said on Tuesday they were close to a deal on a $2 trillion stimulus package to limit the coronavirus pandemic's economic toll.

Title: Markets seen volatile as investors nervous about 21-day nationwide lockdown
Summary:
Indian stock markets are likely to stay volatile on Wednesday after Prime Minister Narendra Modi declared a nationwide lockdown for 21 days, which will further hit the slow-moving economy.
MSCI's broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan rose 1.3% with Australian shares rising 4.5% and South Korean shares gaining 4.0%.
Investor fears about a sharp economic downturn are easing after the US Federal Reserve's offer of unlimited bond-buying and programs to buy corporate debt.
The COVID-19 pandemic induced stock market carnage coupled with high debt levels has put Future Group promoter Kishore Biyani in a tight spot.
In the currency market, the dollar has slipped as a greenback liquidity crunch loosened slightly.

Title: Gold prices today jump ₹600 per 10 gram, silver rates surge about ₹2,000
Summary:
Gold prices in India rose sharply today tracking an uptick in global rates after US Federal Reserve launched unlimited quantitative easing.
On MCX, gold futures were up 1.5% or about ₹600 per 10 gram to ₹41,780, extending their ₹700 gain of the previous session.
Silver futures on MCX rebounded 5% or about ₹2,000 per kg to ₹39,861 per kg, extending their 6% gain of the previous session.
Gold prices in India have seen a big swing this month, hitting a record high of about ₹45,000 per 10 gram and thereafter correcting to about ₹39,500 levels.
Spot gold climbed 2% to $1,583.53 per ounce after rising 4% in the previous session.

Title: Gold Prices Rise Strong Through $1610/Oz as a Breakdown in London Fixing Drives Volatility and Concerning PMI Data Increases Risk-Aversion
Summary:
An unusual Tuesday drop-in today, as the volatile moves we’ve seen in the gold market this morning warrant some discussion.
Gold prices are trading with strength near well above $1600/oz, a key recovery level and a line of major psychological “round number” resistance.
Gold prices saw a wild burst of volatility this morning following the usual time of the LBMA gold and silver price fixes.
Crashing PMI Data in Developed Markets Drives Risk-Aversion—and Gold Buying—HigherGold prices were trading at $1600/oz prior to this morning’s frenetics, driven steadily higher through safe haven buying.
The EuroZone’s PMI data arrived in the earliest morning hours, broadly as dour as expected although the German manufacturing numbers were particularly concerning.

Title: Gold prices today fall sharply after rising for 3 days
Summary:
Gold prices in India fell sharply today, snapping a three-day gain as the country goes into a 21-day lockdown.
Gold prices in India have unperformed global markets as the lockdown hits trading volumes and demand.
On the other hand, in global markets, gold advanced for a third straight session today, hitting its highest in about two weeks.
Spot gold gold today rose as much as as much as 1.6% to $1,635.79 earlier in the day - its highest since March 12.
Fed’s latest stimulus measures has also lifted silver prices.

Title: Dow Has Biggest Rally Since 1933, Surging 11.4% On Stimulus Hopes
Summary:
At the close, the Dow Jones Industrial Average had risen by 11.4 percent to 20,704.91Wall Street posted its best performance in nearly 90 years on Tuesday, as indices rallied on hopes that lawmakers would soon agree on a massive stimulus package to blunt the coronavirus' economic impact.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average surged 11.4 percent rallying to end the session at 20,704.91, its biggest one-day percentage increase since 1933.
The tech-rich Nasdaq gained 8.1 percent to close at 7,417.86, while the broad-based S&P 500 finished the day at 2,447.33, a gain of 9.4 percent.
They also have proposed offering $500 billion to corporations, including $50 billion to revenue-strapped airlines, as well as $300 in loans to small businesses.
"The key is to get the money out as quickly as possible and not wait," Krosby said.

Title: Stock futures up as investors await coronavirus response stimulus package
Summary:
New York (CNN Business) Asian markets jumped Wednesday, following Wall Street's major surge overnight as US lawmakers inched closer to approving a stimulus bill to respond to the coronavirus crisis.
DowS&P 500NasdaqUS stock futures, though, were shaky during Asian trading hours.futures were last down 150 points, or 1%, reversing slight gains earlier in the evening.futures were down 1% andfutures were down 1.4%, also falling out of the green.

Title: Coronavirus pandemic: Wall Street set to bounce from 3-year lows
Summary:
Wall Street was set to bounce from three-year lows on Tuesday, as signs of Washington nearing a deal on a $2 trillion economic rescue package gave a shot of optimism to markets reeling under the biggest selloff since the global financial crisis.
Follow LIVE updates on coronavirus pandemicThe benchmark index has lost $10 trillion in value since a record high last month.
While the rescue package and the Fed's historic boost will ease some pain in financial markets, traders remained doubtful of a long-lasting recovery without evidence of a peaking in the number of new COVID-19 cases.
At 08:20 am EDT, Dow e-minis were up 723 points, or 3.91 per cent, S&P 500 e-minis were up 87.75 points, or 3.95 per cent and Nasdaq 100 e-minis were up 269 points, or 3.85 per cent.

Title: Coronavirus: DoT writes to states to permit working of telecom personnel
Summary:
The Department of Telecom on Tuesday reached out to state governments over difficulties faced by personnel of service operators in their movements due to lockdowns imposed by authorities to contain coronavirus outbreak.
While telecom services have been listed within the essential services, employees maintaining the network and managing operations have complained of facing problem in their movement.
"Hence, it will be necessary that instructions reach the field level to permit personnel maintaining and providing telecom services to continue their work without interruption," the letter said.
Telecom companies like Reliance Jio have announced free broadband service to new customers and doubled data limit for all existing customers to support work from home in fight against coronavirus.
Read: Coronavirus India update: State-wise total number of confirmed casesState-owned telecom companies BSNL and MTNL took lead last week to announce free broadband plans and additional data for their customers to support work from home.

Title: DoT wants nodal officers to monitor telecom infra
Summary:
Muntazir.Abbas@timesinternet.inNEW DELHI The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has asked chief secretaries of states and advisors to UT administrators to designate nodal officers to ensure maintenance of telecom infrastructure amid curfew and lockdown.Telecom secretary Anshu Prakash said in a March 24 letter that "telecom infrastructure is critical for maintaining communication, use of broadband and internet services, encouraging e-commerce and facilitating work from home during the restriction period.”The development comes on the back of multiple complaints particularly in Punjab and Maharashtra where local law enforcement authorities were not allowing service operators and infrastructure providers' field workforce to visit sites requiring maintenance.Prakash sought intervention from state officials to allow operational continuity of telecom services, considered essential and critical to enabling work from home (WFH) as multinationals primarily IT/ITes companies have advised their staff to stay indoors.Thirty states and union territories are facing restrictions on public movement due to lockdown and curfew.
"It will be necessary that instructions reach field level to permit personnel maintaining and providing telecom services to continue their work without interruption," the top official said.Several instances, according to the top official, were being reported where the local authorities have asked the personnel of the telecom service providers at network operation centres and call centres to shut down operations in view of the restrictions.
"Efforts are being made by the Centre and state government as well as telcos and infrastructure providers for the smooth functioning of telecom services and operations in respective states," said TR Dua, director-general at Tower & Infrastructure Providers Association (Taipa).
